title: Massachusetts man pleads not guilty to killing two-year-old 'Baby Doe'
title_page: Massachusetts man pleads not guilty to killing two-year-old 'Baby Doe' | Daily Mail Online
text:
The man accused of killing two-year-old 'Baby Doe' has pleaded not guilty while his lawyer said the toddler's mother was behind the brutal murder.
A clean-shaven Michael McCarthy, 35, was held without bail after denying he killed little Bella Bond and hid her body in a refrigerator last year.
The garbage bag containing Bella's body was discovered on the shores of Deer Island in Massachusetts on June 25.

A clean-shaven Michael McCarthy, 35, was held without bail after denying he killed little Bella Bond and hid her body in a refrigerator last year
McCarthy's attorney Jonathan Shapiro (pictured front) told a Suffolk County Court that Bond has made 'unbelievable' claims about his client and slammed her 'insatiable drug addiction'
However her remains were not identified until September following a huge campaign to find out the name of the slain child.
Her mother Rachelle Bond, who is also McCarthy's boyfriend, accused him of repeatedly punching the girl in the stomach until she died because he believed she was 'possessed by demons'.
But McCarthy's attorney Jonathan Shapiro told a Suffolk County Court that Bond has made 'unbelievable' claims about his client and slammed her 'insatiable drug addiction'.
He added that she had a history of child neglect while McCarthy was more mild-mannered.
Shapiro also said the prosecution's case against McCarthy is 'incredibly weak' and insisted there is no DNA or forensic evidence tying him to the crime.
At McCarthy's arraignment Monday, prosecutor David Deakin described what Rachelle Bond claims she saw after McCarthy allegedly punched the girl to death.
Her mother Rachelle Bond (left pictured in court last week), who is also McCarthy's boyfriend, accused him of repeatedly punching the girl (right) in the stomach until she died because he believed she was 'possessed by demons'
'She saw the defendant sort of half-standing, half-kneeling over the prone girl who was on either the ground or a mattress on the ground and he was moving his arms rapidly around the area of her mid-section,' Deakin said.
The prosecution said the couple stole weights from McCarthy's father's plumbing business and used them to weigh down the baby's body when they threw her in Boston Harbor.
Deakin also claimed McCarthy sent Bond a text when she was in housing court after Bella's death, saying: 'Whatever you do, don't tell them about Bella.'
McCarthy's next court appearance is scheduled for February 16. His lawyer also told the court he is receiving treatment for his heroin addiction in jail.
McCarthy was charged with first-degree murder before Christmas, while Bond was charged with being an accessory after the fact to her daughter's killing.
A larceny charge was added against Bond for allegedly continuing to accept public assistance after she knew her daughter had been killed.
Last week she pleaded not guilty to being involved in her daughter's death.
McCarthy (left) and Bond (right) were charged in connection with the girl's death in December. Her remains took months to identify
